alert.note: Alert for Kennebec; Lincoln; Waldo (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 4:55PM EDT until June 16 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Maine, including the following counties, in south central Maine, Kennebec, Lincoln and Waldo. In southwest Maine, Androscoggin. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 455 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Augusta, Belfast, Gardiner, China, Litchfield, Farmingdale, Manchester, Hallowell, Liberty and Palermo.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
